intro: Tuberaria, commonly known as the bladder campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble bladders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in various regions across Europe and western Asia. Tuberaria has small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. The plant is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
